title: Sampler, early 18th century
medium:
Medium: silk, metal-wrapped silk and hair embroidery, linen foundation 
Technique: satin, Montenegrin cross, long-armed cross, knot, stem, chain, rococo, and running stitches on plain weave
inscribed:
"The sharpness of a needle profit yilds and pleasure
 The sharpness of a tongue bites out of measure"
"Elanor Guest wrought this sampler".
provenance: ex. coll. Mrs. Henry E. Coe (Eva Johnston Coe)
creditline: Bequest of Mrs. Henry E. Coe
description: Alphabets, floral designs, verse, signature and Virgin and Child with Shepherds.

tombstone.epitaph:
Sampler, early 18th century.
early 18th century. Medium: silk, metal-wrapped silk and hair embroidery, linen foundation 
Technique: satin, Montenegrin cross, long-armed cross, knot, stem, chain, rococo, and running stitches on plain weave. Bequest of Mrs. Henry E. Coe. 1941-69-229.
